title: Workshop on Mathematics Instructional Design Based on the ARCS Motivation Model

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Proficiency in Online Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Environment enabling real-time collaboration using personal devices, measuring learning outcomes through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Explain how to apply the four elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) to math instruction.
Design math education scenarios based on the ARCS model to motivate students.
Develop and evaluate math project assignments that incorporate ARCS elements in an online environment.

resources: AR Content Sample for Mathematics Education
Online Collaboration Tools (Google Jamboard, Miro, etc.)
Zoom Screen Sharing and Breakout Room Features

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
